thread.title: 'SEC Nation' Setup: Tebow, Finebaum, McElroy, Spears and fans hit Alabama campus
thread.title_full: 'SEC Nation' Setup: Tebow, Finebaum, McElroy, Spears and fans hit Alabama campus

author: Ben Flanagan | bflanagan@al.com
title: 'SEC Nation' Setup: Tebow, Finebaum, McElroy, Spears and fans hit Alabama campus
text:
Comments 
TUSCALOOSA, Alabama -- Crimson Tide fans got a sneak peek at the SEC Network's Saturday pregame show "SEC Nation," as the crew and stars set up shop in front of Little and Moore Halls on the University of Alabama campus Friday afternoon. 
Former SEC football stars and current SEC Network analysts Greg McElroy, Tim Tebow and Marcus Spears met with local media prior to greeting spectating fans and hitting the show set for some televised college football talk. 
Their colleague Paul Finebaum broadcast his daily ESPN Radio show just a few feet away, welcoming guests like former Alabama offensive lineman Barrett Jones and Mississippi State superfan Stingray from 2-6 p.m. 
Jones shared a nice reunion with McElroy, while the Outland Trophy-winner also joked with Tebow, telling the Heisman-winner to enjoy his time on the greatest campus in history. 
"SEC Nation" airs on Saturday at 9-11 a.m. central time on SEC Network. The show hits every SEC campus during the college football season, this week stopping in Tuscaloosa to kick off coverage prior to the Alabama-Tennessee game, which begins at 2:30 p.m. in Bryant-Denny Stadium. 
See photos from the "SEC Nation" set, as well as Finebaum's radio show set.
